common_questions: in technical screening? Is it SQL tech questions along with my technical background? Or some thing else?
explain things to me, since all these are internal tools and can't be googled
explain your thought process clearly and consider trade-offs in your design choices
explain DNS, what is this port/protocol, explain how active directory works, what comma
and data structures/algorithms, like big 4/unicorn companies?
interview_tips: at all to help prepare more than I already have so far? I feel like i'm trying anything that even sounds remotely like its something they would be con
you should absolutely stick around 5 years
I wouldn't say it was easy exactly, just easier than others I've done
I wouldn't stick anywhere for 5 years
I would guess getting named tech companies on your resume opens some doors as being former Uber, Stripe, et
You should calculate Real salary jump  by purchasing power, not just by numbers
I would really appreciate some feedback on quality of work and work culture
you should ask them for an extension or tell Twilio you need an answer sooner due to a deadline on another off
red_flags: need cold applications, but yes this can help to some extent
knew these were given development role
and my manager thinks I made the mistake
want to work in my current support project
want to be juggling tasks from both which I think what he will propose
have enough experience and the market is not great right now
you like Texas? Just curious because I personally do like TX and cities like Austin is a great place to work at (no state income tax and good pay)

process_insights.format: Mix of phone screen, technical, behavioral, on-site, virtual
